title: Calories in a Vodka Tonic Drink
meta_description: Discover calories in vodka tonic drink, including carbs from tonic, alcohol content, and nutrition breakdowns for one standard serving.
h1: Calories in a Vodka Tonic Drink
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) vodka mixed with 4 oz (118 ml) tonic water; no garnishes or added sweeteners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, tonic type (regular vs. diet), and mixing ratios. Alcohol content affects totals; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard vodka tonic drink contains about 150 calories, primarily from alcohol and the tonic's sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic instead of regular
Double shot of vodka (3 oz total)

faqs.q: How many calories in vodka tonic drink?
faqs.a: About 150 calories for a standard 1.5 oz vodka with 4 oz tonic.

faqs.q: Are calories in vodka tonic from alcohol or tonic?
faqs.a: Roughly 96 kcal from vodka (alcohol) and 54 kcal from tonic's sugars.

faqs.q: Does diet tonic reduce calories in vodka tonic?
faqs.a: Yes, switching to diet tonic drops it to about 50 kcal total.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a vodka tonic drink?
faqs.a: Approximately 12 g carbs, all from the tonic water's sugars; no fiber or protein.

faqs.q: How does vodka tonic compare to other cocktails?
faqs.a: Lower than sugary mixes like margaritas (200+ kcal), but higher than vodka soda (96 kcal).
